headline.main: TALKS WITH STALIN STILL HELD REMOTE; Roosevelt Says He Would Not Tell of Conference Plans, Even if He Knew of Any

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 31 -- President Roosevelt's refusal at his press conference today to say more about a possible Roosevelt-Churchill-Stalin meeting than that things were coming along pretty well, coupled with Prime Minister Churchill's mention in his speech today of the need to prepare the way for such a meeting, confirmed the impression in official quarters here that it would be a mistake to expect such a three-power conference soon.
abstract: Roosevelt silence on Churchill reference to urgency of Foreign Mins talks and possible Churchill-Roosevelt-Stalin conf indicates remoteness of 3-power talks
